title: R Bug: System command 'mlflow.exe' failed, exit status: -1073741819
body:
On Windows 10 with R version 4.1.2 I try to use MLFlow with a remote server in R.
I'm using R and python version 1.25.1 of the MLflow package.
But it I can't get around the following problem: 

```
> mlflow_log_artifact("/Users/Public/output.txt")
Error in run(mlflow_bin, args = unlist(args), echo = echo, echo_cmd = verbose,  : 
  System command 'mlflow.exe' failed, exit status: -1073741819, stdout & stderr were printed
Type .Last.error.trace to see where the error occurred
```

I found the problem within:
```
> processx::run(command = "/Users/Public/Python_3.8.3.0_64_dotrc/WPy64-3830/python-3.8.3.amd64/Scripts/mlflow.exe",
+               args = "--help",
+               echo_cmd = TRUE,
+               echo = TRUE)
Running /Users/Public/Python_3.8.3.0_64_dotrc/WPy64-3830/python-3.8.3.amd64/Scripts/mlflow.exe --help
Fehler in processx::run(command = "/Users/Public/Python_3.8.3.0_64_dotrc/WPy64-3830/python-3.8.3.amd64/Scripts/mlflow.exe",  : 
  System command 'mlflow.exe' failed, exit status: -1073741819, stdout & stderr were printed
Type .Last.error.trace to see where the error occurred
```

and strangely enough `system` and `system2` do work fine.
when you run the error code through a hex converter you get: 0xC0000005 = -1073741819
which seems to be a windows error return code.

Do you have an idea how to deal with this bug?
